page_content:
Cross section

Version:MissionOS_2.0

A cross section is a 2D slice through a 3D plane, used to determine and interpret ground conditions and other parameters along a single axis.

Creating a Cross section

To create cross section in MissionOS, follow the steps below:

  1. Firstly, log into the application.
  2. Go to the top Left-hand side of the map view.
  3. Select the Selection area > Instruments > Cross section.

 

 

  1. As the cursor shows + sign, draw a cross section across the required area in the map. As the drawing ends, a popup appears as graph selection.
  2. Enter the details and click Add.
  3. Now a new popup appears to assign the newly added cross section to a project hierarchy.
  4. Select the fields and click Save.
    (Refer to the figures below for more details)

 

 

 

 

The saved cross section appears in the Cross Section interface.

  1. To view this, open the Data Manager.
  2. Navigate to System Management > Utilities > Cross Section.
  3. Select the Saved Cross section radio button.

All the saved cross sections get listed here in a table.

Note:

  • You can edit and delete the details based on requirements.
  • From here you can modify the Width, Label, Size and Color of the cross section.

Adding Instruments to Cross section

To add Instruments to cross section, follow the steps below:

  1. Select the radio button 2D.
    In this interface you can add instruments in cross section.
  2. Click Add New. 
  3. Instrument fields under Settlement appears by default.
  4. Enter details in the fields and click Save.
  5. Similarly, you can select each element mentioned as tabs under section and create various configurations. These get listed in a table under 2D.

The following are the elements used in 2D where instrument types are added:

  • Settlement
  • Horizontal Movement
  • Water
  • Extensometers
  • Borehole
  • CPT
  • Load cell
  • Vector

 

Axis Configuration

To create axis configurations, click Axis Configuration button.

New fields appear below. Here you can set Units for fields and Ranges (From & To).

The entered Units and Ranges reflects in the graphs.

Perform the following steps to create axis configuration:

  1. Select the Zoom Box. (Note: If no Zoom Box based axis settings exist for a Cross section, the Project-wide DEFAULT applies)
  2. Select the AGS Parameter if required.
  3. Select the color.
  4. Select the size.
  5. Select the following and the corresponding range:
    • Deflection
    • Settlement
    • Elevation
  6. Click Save.
    The axis configuration is saved.

Cross section graphs

You can also view the permanent cross sections listed in the menu of the Cross Section button in the front portal above the map.
Click the cross section you need to see.

You can see below a typical cross section graph:

 

 

Properties of Cross Section graph:

  • Click Properties at the right-hand side to see the details of the axis settings.
  • Under Instruments choose instruments and click Update.
  • Selected instruments are shown on the graph.
  • Properties like Export to PNG small/large and Add to canvas sheet are capabilities of the Cross section graphs. There is no option to customize the graph.

 

 

To add any pdf attachment, click View/Add Attachments button. Click Upload. Enter the caption and click Save. The PDF attachments get listed. Click Delete to remove the files.

The user can only add attachments to permanent cross sections (2D).

 

 

To create section background map for cross section, go to Admin > Setup > Maps.

Choose Map type as Section Background,

Name the Cross section and upload the Map.

As section background, the uploaded Map is displayed under cross section.

 


The user can zoom the graphs accordingly. To un-zoom, Reset Zoom button is available.

 

 

To watch the Web User Manual video on How To Create and View a Cross section Graph, simply click on the thumbnail or link below:
